Jurisdiction Of The Commonwealth And Of The United States

law.catch_line: Conveyance To United States Of Certain Lands Owned By Commonwealth For Lighthouses.
law.text: The department, with the approval of the governor and council, may, upon the application of an agent of the United States, in the name and behalf of the commonwealth, convey to the United States the title of the commonwealth to any tract of land covered by navigable waters and necessary for the purpose of erecting a lighthouse, beacon light, range light or other aid to navigation, or light keeperâ€™s dwelling; but such title shall revert to the commonwealth if such land ceases to be used for such purpose.
